questions.question: Which of these is NOT one of the SOLID principles?
What is a design pattern in software engineering?
choices: A specific way to format code
A general reusable solution to a common problem
A method of organizing code files

questions.question: Which development methodology emphasizes short iterations and frequent customer feedback?
What is refactoring in software engineering?
choices: Adding new features to existing code
Restructuring code without changing its behavior
Converting code to a different language

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a common version control system?
What is unit testing?
What is the purpose of continuous integration (CI)?
choices: To maintain a single code repository
To merge code changes frequently and run automated tests

questions.question: Which design pattern is used to decouple an abstraction from its implementation?
What is technical debt?
choices: Extra development work from choosing an easy solution now

questions.question: Which of these is an example of a creational design pattern?
What is dependency injection?
choices: A technique where an object receives its dependencies externally
Forcing code to depend on specific implementations

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of code reviews?
Which of these is a key principle of test-driven development (TDD)?
What does SaaS stand for?
What is a microservice architecture?
choices: Breaking an application into small, independent services

questions.question: What is a stub in testing?
choices: A piece of code that simulates the behavior of a component
A bug that can't be fixed

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Singleton design pattern?
choices: To create multiple instances of a class
To ensure a class has only one instance

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Docker containers?
Which is NOT a benefit of pair programming?
What is the primary goal of DevOps?
choices: Eliminate the need for project managers

questions.question: What is a merge conflict in version control?
choices: When two branches can't be merged
When changes from different branches overlap
When a branch is deleted accidentally

questions.question: What is meant by 'separation of concerns' in software design?
choices: Having different teams work on different features
Dividing a program into distinct sections with minimal overlap
Keeping business and technical teams separate

questions.question: Which of these is an example of a behavioral design pattern?
What is the purpose of a load balancer?
choices: To balance the load on a server
To distribute network traffic across multiple servers

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using an ORM (Object-Relational Mapping)?
choices: Abstracting database interactions to use objects

questions.question: What is a RESTful API?
choices: An API that follows REST principles

questions.question: What is the purpose of a firewall?
choices: To protect networks from unauthorized access

questions.question: What does CI/CD stand for?
What is a monolithic architecture?
choices: An architecture where all components are tightly coupled
An architecture that uses only one programming language

questions.question: What is the purpose of a code linter?
choices: To check code for errors and enforce coding standards

questions.question: What is the purpose of a backlog in Agile development?
choices: To prioritize and manage tasks to be completed

questions.question: What is a wireframe in software design?
choices: A visual representation of a user interface layout

questions.question: What is the purpose of an API gateway?
choices: To manage API requests and responses

questions.question: What is the primary function of a database index?
choices: To speed up data retrieval operations
To store backup copies of data

questions.question: What does 'agile' refer to in software development?
choices: A methodology focused on iterative development and customer collaboration

questions.question: What is the purpose of a README file in a project?
choices: To provide instructions on how to use the project
To list contributors to the project
To archive old versions of the project
